greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime divisor of n^4-n^2+1.
comment: All divisors of n^4-n^2+1 are congruent to 1 modulo 12.
a(n) = 13 if and only if n is congruent to 2, -2, 6, or -6 modulo 13.
reference: K. Ireland and M. Rosen, A Classical Introduction to Modern Number Theory, Springer-Verlag, NY, Second Edition (1990), p. 63.
link: N. Hobson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
N. Hobson, Home page (listed in lieu of email address)
example: The prime divisors of 6^4-6^2+1=1261 are 13 and 97, so a(5) = 13.
results.author: Nick Hobson, Nov 26 2006
